active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the risks of exfiltration over physical medium in air-gapped environments like nuclear facilities. Propose and critique mitigations, referencing real-world examples like Agent.btz or Stuxnet, and connect to broader MITRE ATT&CK exfiltration tactics (T1020-T1048).
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in MITRE ATT&CK-based threat hunting. Topic: Exfiltration Over Physical Medium (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Threat Intelligence And Hunting > 011_Threat Hunting > 007_MITRE ATT&CK-Based Hunting > Exfiltration Techniques > Exfiltration Over Physical Medium). Prior knowledge: MITRE ATT&CK framework, exfiltration tactics T1020-T1048, log analysis. Sources: MITRE ATT&CK T1052 (https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1052/), T1052.001 (https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1052/001/), Sysmon docs (https://docs.microsoft.com/sysmon), CIS Controls v8 (Control 13: Data Protection), real-world: Agent.btz, Machete, Remsec, Tropic Trooper, Stuxnet. Key Content: - Definition: Adversaries use physical media (USB, SD cards, HDDs) for data exfiltration, esp. air-gapped nets. - Mitigations: Disable autorun, Group Policy USB restrictions, DLP content inspection, full disk encryption, endpoint USB monitoring. - Detections: Sysmon EID 15/16/17 (USB insert/remove/process), EDR file copy rules, behavioral analytics. - Hunting: SIEM queries e.g., 'EventCode=200 AND TargetFilename:*USB*'. Incorporate these learning objectives [insert full list above]. Use scaffolding layers [insert full list]. Active learning for context [insert summaries]. Generate 75 flashcards following this schema exactly [insert full schema]. Ensure high pedagogical quality: Bloom's coverage, active recall, spaced repetition friendly. Output as JSON array of objects: [{'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'source': '...', 'scaffolding_layer': '...', 'related_objective': '...'}}]. No extra text.
